Concept ACK

Thanks for picking this up!
Concept ACK
Could you add a fuzz test for `TimeOffsets` to replace the timedata one?

Can do, but given how simple the interface is I think it wouldn't be anything more than the below (untested)? Could e.g. add the `.Size()` method back but adding it just for fuzzing might not be ideal?

+FUZZ_TARGET(timeoffsets)
+{
+    FuzzedDataProvider fuzzed_data_provider(buffer.data(), buffer.size());
+    TimeOffsets offsets{};
+    while (fuzzed_data_provider.remaining_bytes() > 0) {
+        (void)offsets.Median();

+        offsets.WarnIfOutOfSync();
+    }
+}

Force pushed to:
- address a [thread safety analysis issue](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29623/checks?check_run_id=22527737631) by annotating `WarnIfOutOfSync()` with a `EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(!m_mutex)` 
- fix [failing functional test](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29623/checks?check_run_id=22527737628) by resetting node_miner's mocktime before connecting to the next outbound
- rebase to latest master to fix native macos job

> but given how simple the interface is I think it wouldn't be anything more than the below

That's good enough. We just want the code to be under test, in case we have change it in the future.

Code review ACK 55b476b015d3a79ec5ea176247d2a70163cd034b I also: - Ran the unit test, which is passing - Ran the functional test, which is passing - Verified that the peer window now shows the offset of each peer.

Done. I was a bit worried `WarnIfOutOfSync()` outputting to stderr would mess with the fuzzer (as [here](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29623/commits/48cc160d70e4d918f5e2e5440b0ab5891499f5cf)), but running it locally seems to work fine so far, not sure if the appropriate paths have been hit already though.

Resolving for now.

Force pushed to:
- remove dependency on C++20's `std::ranges::sort` which is [not yet supported](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29623/checks?check_run_id=22558502170) by the `no wallet, libbitcoinkernel` ci task
- add `timeoffsets` fuzz target as per [review comment](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29623#discussion_r1521434495)
- improve includes and copyright headers

> Verified that the peer window now shows the offset of each peer.

FYI this is not new functionality, you should see the same behaviour on `master`.
Concept ACK, I love simplifications or refactors that are net removing code (+213 â363).

> Previously, we would only calculate the time offset from the first 199 outbound peers that we connected to. This limitation is now removed, and we have a proper rolling calculation. I've reduced the set to 50 outbound peers, which seems plenty.
Previously, we would automatically use the network-adjusted time if the difference was < 70 mins, and warn the user if the difference was larger than that. Since there is no longer any automated time adjustment, I've changed the warning threshold to 20 minutes (which is an arbitrary number).

on the 2 value selections (50 outbound peers):
- 50 sounds reasonable, to be fair best would be to add timestamp in `m_outbound_time_offsets` from `FEELER` connection, itâs an outbound connection type per se. shuffling things more at the AS-level.
- 20 min, i can suggest to pick up 10 min to match average interval-block-time of ~10 min
utACK 5c8e71cb2b827586efd052a87ccc463c99387fcf
`count` isn't type-safe. If the type were to change, the RPC result would silently change as well. It may be better to use a casting tick counter `Ticks<>`.
Same
(See also the line below)
The debug log should not log translated messages, but the original ones

nit: 
```suggestion
    if (m_offsets.size() < 5) return 0s;
```
I think it is fine to keep calling the target `timedata`, to avoid deleting a fuzz input folder and adding a fuzz input folder, with similar data.

body: in fuzz tests, you'll have to use LIMITED_WHILE. Otherwise, the fuzz target will never terminate, if the fuzz input is unlimited in length.
